_header: Of strifes new and fraudulent falseness
Note:
For authorship, see MacCracken (1910)
XMacCracken, Henry Noble. “A New Poem by Lydgate.” Anglia 33 (1910): 283-6.
_description: English song against the Flemings, perhaps by John Lydgate — five 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) inserted in a prose ‘Brut’ chronicle

Lam84.First Lines:
[o]ff stryvys new and fraudulent falsnesseWho so lyst to seek out
                    þe cheef occasioun…
Lam84.Last Lines:
…Thy cowardly flyght cokenay of achaumpyounWhyche darst not
                    fyght and canst so well malygne
Lam84.Attributed Title:
And in despyte of þe flemynges an Englishman made this english yn
                    baladdys (f. 201)
Lam84.Editions:
Brie,  Friedrich,
                        ed.  
             The Brut, or the Chronicles of England.
